textDetails.title: Loved it!
textDetails.positiveText: The whole hotel is so nicely designed and even though our room (shoebox) was quite small, it was very charming and cozy. The location ist great and close to the underground and major sights. The rooftop bar is phenomenal even though it requires reservation even as hotel guests. Also, the service is excellent and we loved how you could communicate with the reception via WhatsApp and they answered in seconds. Overall, we loved our stay at the Hoxton Southwark and would love to come again!

partnerReply.reply:
Dear Emilia, 

Thank you so much for your lovely feedback! We're delighted to hear that you enjoyed the charming design of our hotel and found your room cozy. It's great that our location was convenient for you and that you had a wonderful time at our rooftop bar in Seabird restaurant. We're especially pleased that our service met your expectations, and that our WhatsApp communication was helpful during your stay. We can't wait to welcome you back to The Hoxton Southwark for another fantastic experience!

Best 

The Hox Team

textDetails.negativeText: Not a single drawer in the room.  Sorry, but however cool you may be, everyone needs a drawer for their .. err.. drawers.  Storage space in room was poor in general - 6 hangers for 2 people (and we were staying 4 nights). In fairness, we requested more and they were brought immediately.  Mentioned lack of drawers at checkout and the receptionist agreed, and had clearly heard these comments before. No gym - knew that when we booked, obviously, but website mentioned link ups with local gyms which don’t exist.  Staff at front desk could suggest nothing more than a Pure Gym an unspecified walk away, and no details, not even where to find it.  This hotel is very much aimed at a client base which would use a gym, so for me, this was definitely a demerit.
textDetails.positiveText: Stylish well appointed hotel in great location.  Beautiful communal areas - bars on ground floor and roof terrace are exceptional.  Staff were mostly lovely, a few were too cool to remember why they were there.  All requests - for extras for the room etc - were dealt with very quickly and efficiently.  We were there for a significant birthday and were given a bottle of wine in the room with a thoughtful handwritten note.
textDetails.title: Beautiful hotel in great location, but for the price, could do better

partnerReply.reply:
Dear Fiona, 


Thank you so much for your detailed feedback! We’re thrilled that you enjoyed our hotel’s stylish and personalised design, great location, and the fantastic communal areas. It’s wonderful to hear that your requests were handled quickly, and we’re glad the birthday surprise added a special touch to your stay. We’re sorry to hear the storage space and gym situation didn’t quite meet your expectations. We apologize if we didn’t fully explain the gym location—it’s actually near Waterloo Station, just about a 15-minute walk away and it is 24/7 open. We truly appreciate your comments and will use them to keep improving. We’d love to welcome you back in the future!

Best, 

The Hox Team

textDetails.negativeText: Nothing

textDetails.positiveText: There was a mix up with my booking, which was my mistake arriving a day late. After initially saying they couldn't do anything about it, they came good and moved my 2 night dates forward by a day as it was clearly a genuine mistake. As a result, I would go there again. The front desk staff were great.
textDetails.negativeText: We were hassled out of the downstairs bar area and not able to drink alcohol after 11pm which is a bit ridiculous as residents in a hotel. When I checked my invoicing, they had indeed charged me for 3 nights but they corrected this when I called, but I still needed to call.
textDetails.title: Well positioned good hotel

The fact I couldn’t stay longer.

textDetails.positiveText: Very efficient, friendly and helpful staff, cleaniness of rooms, and porsche ambience at Seabird restaurant. Very hip and vibrant atmosphere on the whole. textDetails.positiveText: Super nice staff. Very friendly and accommodating. Loved our room. Wonderful view onto a park and well decorated. It didn’t feel like a hotel room, more like home. Very comfortable mattress, pillows and comforter. Even though we were more in an office area, we were able to walk almost everywhere. Tube station is also near by. The restaurant downstairs was amazing! The food was so fresh and delicious. We had breakfast and dinner twice there. The restaurant staff was great as well.
textDetails.negativeText:
The area where you could just sit, read a book, write postcards, etc was limited. All the tables were used by the restaurant. We were always able to get two of the seats every evening, but it was February, not a busy season.
You can not open the windows to get fresh air and the temperature in the room did not go below 19 Celsius. We were missing the fresh air.
The water pressure was not good. When I mentioned it at check out, they told me that this was unusual and it could have been fixed. I thought it had to do with the environment. Low water pressure sucks for people with long hair and a full head of hair. The lighting for applying make up is not good either. All lights come from above ( they should come from the side for applying make up) and are not very strong. It was still worth staying here!

textDetails.positiveText:
My wife and I had a fantastic stay at this hotel in London.

The stay at Hoxton was an unforgettable experience.
The staff was very friendly and helpful, and made us feel at home.
In particular, we would like to thank the Italian guy named Francesco for his kindness, helpfulness, and professionalism.
He gave us a lot of useful advice.

The room was clean and comfortable, and the breakfast was delicious.
We also had dinner, and we have to give our congratulations to the chef!

The location of the hotel was great, close to many tourist attractions and well connected.

In summary, we would highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a comfortable and pleasant stay in London. Thanks again to the staff for making our stay so enjoyable.
We will definitely be back.

textDetails.positiveText: Like most Hoxton hotels, the atmosphere is great. A good balance between lively and chilled. My room wasn't huge but it is nicely designed. The bed was very comfortable. The bathroom was a good size for a small room. Very clean and they have nice toiletries. Both the downstairs and rooftop restaurants and bars are great for drinks. The food is pretty good, not incredible. The location is convenient for both the City and West End. The immediate surroundings aren't great but very convenient if you're in and out of Waterloo station. Bonus, I arrived an hour before check in and the staff let me into my room without hesitation.
The only thing good about this hotel is the interiors, but it ends there.
textDetails.title: Totally incompetent staff and not worth the money at all. Should have stayed in an air bnb.
textDetails.negativeText:
Worst service I’ve ever had. 
1. They didn’t clean the rooms, when I asked them to empty our bins they said that servicing the rooms was an extra service we had to request. 
2. Restaurant service was horrendous, waited an hour for a coffee I ordered 3x which arrived cold. Was told there were no tables available for breakfast and that it was my fault because I should have known I was supposed to book. 
3. Asked for early check in months ago because my husband needed to get ready for our wedding ceremony. Check in took so long it ended up being an hour later than it was supposed to be and he had to rush to get ready for his own wedding. 
4. Post wedding breakfast service was so unbelievably slow that my parents had to leave before they could even take our order. 
5. Everyone passes the buck - when you complain they try their best to blame anyone else.

partnerReply.reply:
Hey Katherine,

We are sorry to hear about the few issues you had during your stay, were they reported to the team by any chance? We're always aiming to provide the best service and standards to our guests, and I am sorry to hear that this time they didn't meet your expectations.

Regardless, should you decide to come back and stay with us please do not hesitate to drop me an email so I can make sure you are looked after.

Best,

The Hox Team

textDetails.negativeText:
We stayed 2 nights. I booked a comfy/big room (upgrade). Late on the second night we learned the Huxton does not tidy the room or make the bed on each of the stay. Their rationale was one of ‘eco policy’. I understand how this applies to supplying fresh towels, linen etc but when it comes to tidying the room & making the bed in a luxury hotel line this is taking ‘eco policy’ a step too far. All they are doing is passing the task to the customer and this is simply cost saving (in a setting where the stay is very expensive). House keeping services in cheaper hotel lines is much better than what’s provided here.

As a side note, rooms were noisy (poor sound insulation from the corridor and fellow rooms), the television had only two channels working (BBC1 and 2) and could not connect to the internet/was not fully SMART enabled (meaning no Netflix, Amazon prime etc) the grouting in the shower kept flaking off when it was being used.

textDetails.negativeText:
The lady at the check in was very abrupt and didnt explain where anything was - including the elevator to the rooms and seemed irritated when asked questions about the stay - such as what time breakfast was etc.
We had paid for breakfast to be included however in the morning after waiting at out table for 30 minutes and no one had come to even take our coffee orders or give us menus, we left for a cafe nearby which was such a shame. 
Additionally, I had booked the room 2 months in advance as a surprise getaway for me and my partner as we had always wanted to eat at their restaurant seabird. When we came for our table booked for 8pm, we arrived at 8:05pm, the hostess told us that we were late and therefore wouldnt have a table for us for an hour or more but we could sit at the bar. I explained we had booked this table 2 months in advance and that we had arrived within the grace period. She was extremely rude to her colleague who tried her best to adjust tables to make space for her and batted off her idea's by saying 'please ignore her she is new' which we could visibly see was upsetting for the waitress. 
Eventually 'it was a miracle' that they were able to find us a table tucked next to the hostess stand where they kept knives and forks etc. We felt completely disregarded and it unfortunately set the tone for the whole dinner which we had looked forward to so much. We could see tables by the windows were empty for reservations... though we had reserved so far in advanced this wasnt offered to us. 
The food was amazing but our drinks didnt arrive until we ordered the bill. 
Overall, really disappointed with our stay and dinner experience which is such a shame as we were so excited for our London getaway that I had organised as a surprise, especially as we had read such great things.

textDetails.positiveText:
The hotel's location couldn't have been better. Situated on the vibrant South Bank, we were just a short 5-minute walk away from the underground, making exploring the city incredibly convenient. 

The hotel itself exudes a cozy yet stylish ambiance. The attention to detail in the design and decor was evident, creating a welcoming and comfortable atmosphere. The cleanliness of the entire property was also commendable, and it added to the overall enjoyment of our stay.

The staff were not only professional but also very friendly. Their warm welcome and helpfulness throughout our visit made us feel right at home.

One of the highlights was the hotel's bar and restaurant. The superb offerings on the menu truly impressed us. The combination of delectable dishes and a great selection of drinks made for a delightful dining experience. In conclusion, our stay at this hotel was a remarkable experience. Its fantastic location, stylish setting, cleanliness, friendly staff, and outstanding dining options contributed to a truly memorable visit. We highly recommend this hotel to anyone seeking an unforgettable stay in London's vibrant South Bank.

textDetails.positiveText: Beautiful accommodations. The room was quite livable, spacious, and well-put together. The lobby was vibrant and energetic.

textDetails.negativeText:
A few little things, but they aren’t deal-breakers as we would stay again.
- For the price, would have been nice if housekeeping checked the coffee, tea and water before the end of each day. Always nice to come back to topped up stock.
- Handheld steamers are a nice touch, but they weren’t powerful enough and it took a long time to take light creases out of clothes.
- Being sold the £20pp breakfast rate wasn’t good value, as it’s quite hard to spend that much u less you’re ravenous.
textDetails.positiveText:
- All the staff were faultless; friendly, always welcoming and happy to provide more coffee/water if needed.
- Outstanding decor and design throughout, very clean and well kept.
- Bar/restaurant on the ground floor (Albie) and Seabird on the top with city views had very nice drinks.
- Comfortable bed, fantastic bathroom with toiletries.
- Breakfast was delicious, but it does work out best ordering off the menu if not ravenous.
- Quiet location for a weekend stay, but all bars and restaurants still accessible.
- Great access to three stations and Borough Market (5min walk from Blackfriars, 5min walk from Southwark station, 10min walk to Waterloo and 15min walk to Borough Market).

Warm regards,
The Hox team

textDetails.positiveText:
I recently had the pleasure of staying at The Hoxton in London Southwark, and I can confidently say it was a truly exceptional experience. From the moment I arrived, I was blown away by the hotel's outstanding features and unparalleled service.

First and foremost, the location of the hotel was incredibly convenient, with a metro station just a short walk away, making it easy to explore the city. The hotel's design was modern, chic, and full of character, with unique touches that made it stand out from other hotels. Every corner of the hotel was beautifully curated, creating a stylish and inviting ambiance.

One of the standout aspects of my stay was the exceptional staff. The team at The Hoxton went above and beyond to ensure that my stay was memorable. As a special surprise for my boyfriends birthday, they left a thoughtful gift in our room, which made us feel incredibly valued and appreciated as a guest.

The hotel's bar downstairs was a trendy and vibrant space, perfect for enjoying cocktails and mingling with other guests. The restaurant on the first and top floor was simply outstanding, offering a diverse menu with delicious dishes that satisfied my culinary cravings. The attention to detail and quality of food and drinks was top-notch.

In conclusion, the hotel exceeded all our expectations. I highly recommend The Hoxton to anyone seeking a remarkable stay in London Southwark, and I look forward to returning in the future.

See you soon again!

textDetails.positiveText: It was so lovely to be welcomed back by The Hox with bubbles and a handwritten note! Our first time staying in The Cosy room and it was much bigger than expected (we were in The Roomy for our first stay!).

This is a really lovely hotel to stay at. The welcome at reception was amazing and super friendly. The design of the hotel is also very nice...contemporary rustic but very comfortable too. We stayed in a 'cosy' room category which was a reasonable size with a lovely bathroom featuring a superb rain shower. We were facing the main road but didn't experience any issues with traffic noise at all. The hotel is very well located for the Tate Modern and it's only a short walk along the river to the the South Bank area. We booked the Seabird Restaurant on the first night...an amazing rooftop venue on top of the hotel which would be fantastic in the summer although there were plenty of heaters if you wanted to sit outside and brave the early spring weather. We were seated near the kitchen service area at first which was a little too noisy and brightly lit for us. After requesting to move, we had a much nicer seat with stunning views across the city. The fish was amazing and the service was very friendly and attentive. Will definitely head back to The Hoxton on our next visit to London.

textDetails.title: Great venue and location but failing basic processes
textDetails.negativeText: although a nice hotel, the processes are a real mess: for some reason one of our reserved bookings (confirmed by booking.com) went lost : they sorted it out but not a nice start. Then there was a real issue with the payment : although they even “over-guaranteed” the total amount of our stay, they could not use that for payment and used the same amount at payment : result : my total authorised amount on credit card was ruined and luckily I had another credit card to just pay our stay. Even ordering the right cab was difficult as well as booking a table for breakfast. Really had the impression the staff was willing but too inexperienced to handle the issues. Finally I really did not appreciate the fact that I always had to ask to clean up the room (so called green policy : ok but turn it around : do cleanup except if agreed not to do so).  In short : great location, nice venue but the failing processes would make me choose for another hotel.

textDetails.positiveText: The room was hip & classy. We like the enclosed shower (no water spilling out to the bathroom.) unlike other hotel whose shower has half enclosure. textDetails.negativeText: We stayed for 8 nights and we were told we need to inform the front desk each morning to get our room clean. Hmm....we did and there was 1 day, we came back at 4pm and it still wasn't clean and we had to get them to clean the room. The next day, we came back at midnight and the room wasn't clean. We didn't have clean towels, water and dustbin was filled up. The late night front desk was very helpful...immediately provide us with clean towel and water. The late night front desk immediately advised us that she will keyed in the system to have our room clean everyday. That's was very helpful ...but why didn't the front desk does this the very first day we checked in. Apart from this minor thing, the stayed was wonderful. We understand the sustainability dingy but in winter, we need dry and clean towel each day, bin to be throw away and water is essential...basic things.

textDetails.title: Lovely, pleasant stay!
textDetails.positiveText:
Loved my stay there! Located in London's Southwark neighborhood, the Southwark tube station is nearby, however, during the time I visited, it was closed so transportation was a bit of a challenge. A walking distance to City of Westminster, Somerset House, and Covent Garden, the location was a +++!

Flew to London for my birthday which falls on Christmas Eve and upon arriving there, the front desk was so friendly and accommodating! It was a pleasant encounter with all of them making me feel so welcomed.

Once I got to my room, it exceed my expectations- the room was good-sized, the decor was beautiful, and the bathroom? SUPERB!! They also surprised me with a nice personalized Christmas and Happy Birthday message on a paper with compliments of my stay there.

Had breakfast there and the food was amazing!!

Would definitely stay there again 10/10!

textDetails.positiveText:
As all Hoxton hotels I‘ve been to so far, the Hoxton Southwark is stylish and immediately feels like home.
From the comfortable lobby to the cute and rather spacious rooms, all the way to the friendly and welcoming staff - staying at a Hoxton is always a treat. 
Perfectly located near Southwark tube station, many points of interest are within walking distance (Borough Market, Shakespeare Globe, Tate Modern, St.Pauls, etc.)
Would stay here again anytime!

textDetails.positiveText: Beautiful, very quiet room with a very comfortable bed. The hotel is 3 min walk from Southwark Jubilee line metro station, which has direct (2 stops) access to Westminster, yet the neighborhood is very quiet and free of large crowds. The staff was always professional and helpful. I was contacted early on, just after the booking, to check whether I need anything else and everything, what was agreed, was provided. From the 2 restaurants available, we only ate breakfasts at the Albie (next to reception) and it was good.
textDetails.negativeText: Hard to point anything. There are better breakfast options in similar price (for example The Table Cafe) - but you need to walk 5-10 mins and book in advance.

The only (minor) downside is that the mini fridges arbt quite big enough to hold a bottle without some serious balancing work! 


You can get an ice bucket from reception, but it's just a bit more hassle.
textDetails.positiveText:
Amazingly friendly and helpful staff also took delivery of a birthday cake and set it all up in the room with plates and forks for us! 

Room had a spectacular view of big Ben and the London Eye, everyone couldn't have been more helpful or welcoming

Love the breakfast menu, everything excellent and reasonably priced.  Other local hotels charge a per head charge (c£25) for breakfast which is not helpful when you(or your kids) only want toast but still get charged the full whack.  
Room decor is fantastically quirky.
Straightforward pricing for everything. No hidden costs or expensive in-room items.

textDetails.title: Excellent location for Southbank theatres
textDetails.positiveText: I usually travel to a different part of London, but this time I needed somewhere south of the river. The area around the hotel was unexpectedly vibrant, and I enjoyed the local restaurants and Blackfriars food market. The Old Vic, Young Vic, National Theatre, and Shakespeare's Globe were all within easy walking distance. Excellent location for all. Also an easy walk to Waterloo station, and good bus routes. My room was very quiet, and I felt safe and comfortable at the hotel as a single traveller.
textDetails.negativeText: The only negative was the bar drinks were very expensive (although probably not out of the ordinary for London).

All of the staff were extremely helpful and pleasant (throughout the hotel and in Seabird - the rooftop bar/restaurant - and lobby bar). The room was lovely and had some great amenities such as the radio, USB plug sockets, a fridge, a socket next to the mirror, a small table and chairs, and even a clothes steamer! Water, milk, and coffee/tea being complimentary was also brill. The bed was very comfy, and we had a nice view of a neighbouring church.

textDetails.negativeText: The bar is closing to early.

A female receptionist (23rd/5/2022) ruined our night and rest of the our trip. We had somewhere important to go, a huge part of our trip to London, we called from our room and requested a taxi for 9.45pm. We were told to be outside at this time.

At 9.45pm, we got down to the reception only for her to admit to us that she didn’t actually book the taxi because she couldn’t find one. Meanwhile she was just chatting and laughing with a male colleague. She said she was going to try again and within seconds, she assured us that she found one. She asked us to go wait outside that the taxi will be arriving in 8 mins. 

We stood outside waiting in the cold for 9 mins, and I called the receptionist again, she picked up the phone as said the taxi will take another 7 mins, and asked me if I needed her to book another one. 

I asked her “are you sure you actually booked a taxi, we have somewhere important to be”. She reassured me that the taxi was booked and was on his way. She even asked if I was calling with my number so she can call when the taxi arrived. We waited and waited in the cold and got no call or taxi. 

We were super late and I eventually found an Uber nearby. Our mood was ruined before we even got there and we had to leave within mins. Seeing how our important night was ruined, we had to cancelled the rest of the plans for the trip, including the seabird on Sunday, which I was charged £40 for cancelling. 

This extremely disappointing to say the least and one experience I will never forget. I felt neglected and ignored! As a woman a colour, sadly, this is something we had to deal it. We had traveled all the way from Devon. I would have preferred that she declined my request for a taxi, so I could find one by myself. 

We met her on Monday morning (25th) while checking out and she met us with a frown, no apologies, nothing, acted like she forgot what she did !!!

I do hope you give us another chance in the future so we can make up for this.

The Hox

It is well located, in walking distance of major attractions and restaurants but quiet enough that you don't bump into a million tourists as soon as you step out of the door. Room amenities and wifi quality are very good.
textDetails.negativeText:
My least favorite sentence during my stay : did you reserve ? In addition to people staying there, the hotel seem to be a popular destination for local people looking to get a drink or a bite to eat, therefore you're not guaranteed to find space right away if you want that late afternoon drink at the bar or decided to have breakfast before visiting the city. 
We managed to have breakfast there the first half of our trip, and the food was excellent but the service quite slow, drinks would be long gone by the time the food showed up. Not a issue at night if you're having dinner, but wasted time at the start of the day. We eventually skipped breakfast there and found many places near by to satisfy our coffee needs ! 
In summary, if you're organized and reserve in advance, you won't have any issues but if you want to be spontaneous, expect some setbacks.

textDetails.title: Gorgeous Hotel but poor value for money.
textDetails.negativeText:
Not great value for Monday. The rooms are TINY. Not appropriate for 2 x people with luggage. We had nowhere to put our bags and suitcases so we had to step over them to move around the room. 
Not excellent value for the price, the bathroom was missing all the toiletries you would expect in a hotel (basic products like soaps, body lotion etc). There is no gym in the hotel but they do have a gym that they partner with except we were charged 10pound a day to use it. Again, something that should have been included for the price of the room. 
No daily housekeeping - you have to ask for it at reception.  All these things are small cost-cutting tactics which is fine in a basic hotel but should be basic expectations at the Hoxton.

textDetails.positiveText: What a hotel. Had such a lovely stay here and will be  definitely returning. Staff were so friendly and made such an effort to make our stay the best we could have hoped for. Arrived a little early before check in but had our room ready within a couple of hours after we went for breakfast. Also upgraded us to a bigger room free of charge. There was a lovely welcome letter for us upon entry to our room. Room service food was so nice and was very quick too. We were greeted politely everytime we entered and left the hotel. We had a late flight when leaving so asked if there was any option of late check out. Reception gave us a 4pm late check out with no extra charge. Cant say enough about the staff. The hotel decor is stunning but the staff make this hotel what it is. Top marks from us!

textDetails.positiveText:
4 min walk from the Southwark tube station, and a 10 minute walk from Waterloo. It was my first time staying in this part of London and I must say I liked it. I got the feel that this is a cool, upcoming neighbourhood and I expect more hotels and restaurants to start popping up there in the near future. 
The Hoxton building itself was majestic. It is a tall, new building and I was blown away by the beautifully designed reception area with its signature Hoxton style cafe and bar on the ground floor.
textDetails.negativeText: I opted for the more spacious Roomy room, which was minimalist, elegant and well spaced out. The view from the room overlooked the park and tennis courts in the distance. My only gripe with the room was the lack of ventilation. The windows do not allow for opening and the extraction the bathrooms are not effective, to the point that I could see there was a problem with mould developing in the shower.
textDetails.title: I am a big fan of the Hoxton group and the Southwark did not disappoint. Please figure out an effective way to improve v
We loved it so much that we booked again
textDetails.positiveText:
I have no bad comments to make, afterall my partner and I loved this hotel so much that we came back for a second time within the space of a few months. Some highlights below:

+ Lovely restaurants.
+ Rooftop Bar.
+ Lovely rooms.
+ Exceptionally clean.
+ Welcoming staff.
+ Always felt safe...even during Covid.
+ Metres from Southwark station (on the Jubilee line).

textDetails.negativeText:
Prior to the stay I tried to book a table for dinner to celebrate my wife's 40th. The staff didn't know what they were doing and just advised me that as a guest we'd automatically have a table. 2 weeks before our check in date I called to confirm the table reservation and I was informed that there wasn't any availability for that evening.
On our arrival we tried to get a table drinks and were very rudely informed that there was no tables and it was their policy that no one could stand at the bar.
In short the staff need to communicate better with guests and between themselves.
One last thing, better pillows and more of them should be already in the room.

partnerReply.reply:
Hey Katie,

We are sorry to hear about the service at the bar, your feedback will help to re-train our teams and ensure this doesn't happen again if you decide to give us another chance.
We are glad to hear that overall you enjoyed the hotel and we hope you see you at The Hox soon!

Best,

Jorge

textDetails.positiveText: the hotel had a great vibe, relaxed, clean,chic and the food was amazing. great selection of drinks and really lovely staff. love that breakfast went until late and checkout wasn’t at the crack of Dawn! The room itself was equipped with a hand steamer which is genius, the hairdryer in the room was also powerful and of good quality. Having a decent amount of shampoo, conditioner (amazing as a long haired woman!!) and shower gel of great quality was very much appreciated. We loved that the room was pristine, clean and had everything we needed whilst looking great- adores the retro light switches and chic bathroom. It was clear that a lot of though had gone into the positions of everything including (hallelujah) a plug next to the mirror so I could dry my hair- small but thoughtful!

textDetails.negativeText:
For the price I didn’t think the room was stocked that well with toiletries or mini bar / coffee and tea facilities.
The roof bar is only open until 10.30pm for drinks (and you can’t get bar snacks). I understand the hotel might not want public guests but it’s way too early to close to hotel guests on a Thu/ Fri night in a major city. 
You also couldn’t get room service past 10.30pm

We had booked for a special occasion - a note had been left in our room but the customer service at reception was perfunctory. When we arrived in our room we went into the bathroom to find it had been used. Wet shower, towels on the floor - something I’ve never experienced anywhere and certainly highly concerning given covid regulations. When we let reception know we were moved room however ended up next to a highly vocal couple couple. We were offered complementary breakfast however when we went down the next day we were lectured by the restaurant staff that we needed to have booked.

Everything seemed like SUCH an effort for staff and we were made to feel like we were not valued guests. 

All effort seemed to have gone into the styling rather than anyone having a comfortable stay.

Total waste of money - will not be going back.

textDetails.negativeText:
Room was nice but felt a bit flat. Decor I couldn’t fault it was gorgeous and clean! Reception made a point of telling me everything in the room was complimentary but it was some water and a little jug of milk. Granted that’s more than some places but for such a fun hotel chain (and not a cheap one at that) I expected a bit more. Minimum a bag of M&Ms. 

Albie the restaurant downstairs is nice, good for working in during the day. Felt a bit hurried if I’m honest. Staff are obviously used to a quick turn around on tables but that’s not really a vibe. Only had the coffee and pastries from Albie. 1st day croissant was warm and fresh, second day felt like they’d gone to a Tesco express. Again, fell flat on such an easy win.

textDetails.positiveText: Literally everything! The location was perfect, very close to Southwark station and 5 mins away from pretty much everywhere in London. The room was so cosy and was good to come back to a comfy bed after all the walking you do. The interior design is what we loved the most as it’s both rustic and modern. All the staff was lovely and explained everything you need to know.

Lovely breakfast and I was kindly offered a seat by the window. It seems like a small thing but I find that, as a solo traveller, you're often treated as if you're a burden and get given the worst seats and tables; however this wasn't the case at Albie at breakfast.
textDetails.negativeText: As a hotel in central London and with conference facilities it was normal and expected to see people coming for work meeting and it just adds a different atmosphere to when you're just chilling there on your holiday. However this is not a critique of the hotel at all.

textDetails.positiveText:
The lovely reception staff accommodated our early check-in request, which meant we were able to leave all our bags in the room and head out. So helpful!
The rooms are beautifully decorated, very clean and we barely heard any noise. The bed was extremely comfortable with a really squishy duvet. 
It was my partner's birthday so they had even left a thoughtful note and some sweets for him in the room.
The hotel is brilliantly located to explore Southbank, Westminster, Covent Garden and beyond. There are lots of attractions within 10-15 minutes' walk, for example the BFI, the National Theatre, London Dungeons... we went to the BFI Odeon iMax to see a film. 
After strolling along the river we wandered back to the hotel and sat in some very comfy armchairs in The Albie. We had a few drinks and a bite to eat. It was all delicious. The cocktails are quite pricy but beers and so on were standard London pricing. The bar area is very tastefully done and has a relaxed atmosphere. We could have spent longer but we had to get ready to meet some friends.
We got back too late unfortunately to sample the desserts or cocktails up in the Seabird. (The kitchen closed at 10.30 and the bar closed at 11.30). But they did let us pop up to relax on the beautiful terrace/balcony and admire the views of London at night. The music was fun, there were heaters to stop you getting too chilly in the breeze and it felt like being on holiday. 
(FYI the reception have a mini bar if you fancy a night cap but the choice is a bit limited).
We both slept so well and would happily have stayed in bed hours longer were it not for commitments. We had arranged to have brunch elsewhere so we didn't sample breakfast in the hotel.
All in all a lovely stay and we both want to come back!

There was an issue with my breakfast but the friendly staff didn't charge me for it, which was very considerate.
I thought it was a bit weird that as a guest you cannot turn off the fan in the room completely (there is always a bit of a draft if you put it on low or it's too hot if you put it on medium/high) you have to ask staff to do it for you. Would be great to have the option to turn it off yourself.
